message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a framework for learning representations on graphs using local convolution filtering. This is a topic that is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE), and social and information networks (cs.SI). Given that the paper focuses on graph classification, which is a task commonly studied in machine learning, cs.LG is the most likely sub-category. However, the use of Gaussian mixture models and the integration of edge information may also make the paper relevant to cs.CV and cs.AI. The use of neural networks in the proposed framework may also make it relevant to cs.NE. Finally, the study of graphs and their properties is a topic of interest in cs.SI.
